page.title: 20SUMMERCOURT FAIR
page.content: The fair dates from 1201. Originally the fair was held at Penhale but for reasons unknown was transfered to Summercourt in about 1711.Gypsies in tents and high class travellers were typical visitors to the fair in those days.Much trading was done and the toss of a coin would sometimes secure a pony for between Â£1.50 and Â£5.00 cheap jacks squabbled over the best pitches and local youths pitted their strength against the booth boxers and wrestlers.The fair today has changed, fewer animals are sold ,market traders dominate the edge of the central fair field in which there are many booths and stalls such as dodgems,roundabouts big wheels, noahs arks and twisters. Fair day,25th September draws many local people to Summercourt for an annual reunion.The police have to close the road through the village.
